Atmospheric river bringing heavy rain, winds — here’s how long it will last

The post-Christmas atmospheric river is streaming into all corners of Northern California and churning up heavy rainfall and debris-inducing wind gusts across the Bay Area this Tuesday. How Oakland’s Fruitvale became a thriving Guatemalan enclave

Over the past 10 years, Oakland’s Fruitvale neighborhood has seen an influx of Guatemalan people who identify as Mam. Benefiting from the many social programs and networks of support, this community has integrated into the community. Today you can see their impact with colorful clothing stores and fried chicken stands.
